summary: This document is an email chain from October 2020 regarding the forensic imaging of devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein's properties in New York and the Virgin Islands. An Assistant U.S. Attorney thanks a NY CART Coordinator for their extraordinary effort in processing the devices, with the coordinator indicating completion is imminent.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the main email, expressing gratitude for the forensic imaging work on Epstein's devices. The name appears to be a title/role placeholder rather than a specific individual.

persons.name: NY CART Coordinator
persons.context: The individual who was in the office all weekend processing images from Epstein devices seized in New York and the Virgin Islands, providing a timeline for delivery.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The AUSA is coordinating with and thanking the CART Coordinator for forensic work on the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Forensic Imaging Update
events.description: NY CART Coordinator reports being done with all but 5 or 6 machines from the Epstein device seizures and will provide images the following afternoon.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: AUSA Thanks Forensic Team
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney expresses gratitude for the extraordinary effort in imaging devices from Epstein searches.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: Forensic imaging of devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein's properties in New York and the Virgin Islands was actively ongoing in October 2020.
A NY CART Coordinator worked through a weekend to process 'all but 5 or 6 machines' from the seizures.

An Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York expressed being 'very, very grateful for the extraordinary effort,' indicating the importance of this forensic work to the investigation.
The email chain is external, flagged as such in the subject line, concerning evidence from the Epstein case.
The correspondence shows ongoing post-Epstein death investigative activity by federal prosecutors related to seized digital evidence.
